result.execSummary:
The defendant Katrina M. Viau was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs)

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Waushara Co Case Nos. 2015CM000215 and 2015CM000355

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to obtain and maintain full time employment.    Defendant to obtain a GED or HSED during the pendency of probation term.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Defendant is not to issue any checks.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Same repayment provisions apply as noted above for Count No. 2.

records.addlTxt: 05-22-2016 Waushara County Jail inmate request to court-Denied
Payment made and PP agreement signed

15CF-123, 15CM-215, 15CM-348 and 15CM-355 - All Cases Called @ 2:41 PM: Defendant Katrina M. Viau in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Global resolution recited by ADA.  Def and SPD confirm State's recital.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  15CF-123 - Accepts State's Motion to Amend Ct 2 to Misd Level BJump contrary to s. 946.49(1)(a) Plea Ct 2 and 3:  NC  15CM-215 - Plea Ct Nos 1, 2 and 3:  NC  15CM-355 - Plea Ct 1:  NC  Court accepts 6 pleas and enters JOC.  15CF-123 Ct 1 DRI.  15CM-215 Ct Nos 4-15 all DRI.  15CM-348 DRI in its entirety.  15CM-355 Ct 2 DRI.  Statement by Def:  Yes.  The Court:  As to each Count - S/W - 3 yrs probation - concurrent terms.  Ct 1 of 15CM-355 only - 75 days WCJ - Huber, No GT, No TS credit, if revoked however 8 days credit for time served in the event of revocation.  Conditions:  AODA and any follow thru as recommended; the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; maintain FT employment; No issuance of checks; Complete HSED or GED; Restitution of $1831.62, no specific monthly payment schedule ordered due to Dane Co matter and release date unknown from custody; DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Appeal Rights Given.

15CF-123, 15CM-215, 15CM-348 and 15CM-355 - All Cases Called @ 9:30 AM: Defendant Katrina M. Viau in court, in custody, with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  15CM-348/15CM-355:   Both Complaints Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  NGP received and entered as to both matters.   As to companion case assigned to Atty Templeton as to 15CM-215 - Court relieves Atty Templeton for subsequent counsel appointment by SPD.   Def remains incarcerated on sanction sentence to and until 11/2/2015.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 01:45 pm.

15CF-123 and 15CM-215 - Both Cases Called @ 10:55 AM:  Defendant Katrina M. Viau in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Atty Dave Templeton appears via telephone as to companion 15CM-215.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Templeton:  Has not rec'd offer yet due to new charge and possible charges in Dane Co.  Requests add'l STC.  Per ADA:  Believes that both cases will be resolved together.  The Dane Co matter has been concluded on 8/26/2015.  STC to be scheduled w/in next 30 days as to both matters.  Amended Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed.  Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing.   Amended Complaint describes facts that felony crimes were committed. Def BOT.  ARGN to proceed.  INFO Filed - Stated - Reading Waived.  NGP rec'd and entered as to all 3 offenses.  STC Scheduled as to both cases - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 09:30 am.
No operation of any motor vehicles whatsoever.

Case Called @ 1:12 PM: Defendant Katrina M. Viau in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Per SPD - eligibility confirmed.  DA argues for cash bond of approx $300-$500 at Court's discretion.  Argument as to bond of SPD.    The Court:  Orders bond of $2500 Signature w/Conditions.   IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 10:45 am.
